newsitem.title: USA: Service says Q2 improved despite trends.
newsitem.headline: Service says Q2 improved despite trends.

text.p: Service Corp International said Monday that by controlling costs it grew its second-quarter revenues despite what the funeral and cemetery company described as "more than normal seasonal softness in our industry."
Service Corp said in a news release that its U.S. operations, which account for almost 80 percent of its consolidated income, controlled costs to help boost the company's earnings.
Service Corp said that during the second quarter it closed 28 transactions and acquired 78 funeral service locations, 10 cemeteries and six crematoria for $117 million.
These acquired businesses are expected to produce $46 million in annual revenues, excluding about $19 million in annual revenues from the acquisition of Marsellus Casket Co, Service Corp said.
